answers.author: Tom Richardson
answers.text:
The Sonoma County Human Services Department just purchased a learning management system (LMS) that will do that and much more. A state-of-the-art LMS will essentially do five things, all online. Register people for classes, manage licenses and certificates, store training records, deliver online content (eLearning), and manage first level evaluations. We do not have the system installed yet so we have no experience with it but we are using three different systems for those five functions. Colleagues who have LMS's have commented that they are "wonderful" once you work out the bugs and learn how to use them. Our system is called TrainingPartner (brochure attached) and if you do a web search for "learning management system" you'll find bunches of them.

answers.author: Edward Chew
answers.text:
The City of Chula Vista uses an on-line training management program called "Prevention Link". It's from a company called Target Solutions. Here's the link: http://targetsolutions.com/
We can push training programs out to the staff (video's, powerpoints, etc) as well as track all training completed.  If you want more information, you can call our Risk Management Division at (619)691-5096 and speak with the Risk Manager.

answers.author: J. Munger
answers.text:
Our city uses a portal through http://www.sungardps.com/ to oversee and administer all training programs. Even in-person training such as annual drug overviews, etc. are administered by this website. 
Employees can even print their transcripts for their own records.

author: Sarah Saunders
text: The City of Tamarac is interested in learning more about software to track employee training hours. If your organization currently uses this type of software we would like to know more about it. Specifically, the name of the software, the cost (if available), how your organization is using the software (is it used for more than just tracking hours?, etc.), and your experience with the software thus far. Thank  you in advance for all of your assistance!
title: Does your organization use a software to track employee training hours?
